intro: Cheilosoria insignis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has fleshy, thick leaves that help it store water, adapting to its native semi-arid environment. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically borne on upright stems. Cheilosoria insignis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
